TLINE.TDLINE: &CAUSE&
You are attempting to run Delta Mode without specifying at least one
WESOUT Application value.
&SYSTEM_RESPONSE&
The programme will not continue until you have resolved the issue and
entered a WESOUT Application value.
&WHAT_TO_DO&
Select one or more options from the available list.
&SYS_ADMIN&
The technical reason for this is the WESD_WIND entries are specific to a
WESOUT Application and this information is used to determine which delta
records are relevant. Therefore because you have chosen Delta processing
mode you are required to enter an Application.
&CAUSE&
You are trying to run the programme for specific recipients - this is
possible only if you disable the option to update WIND entries.
&SYSTEM_RESPONSE&
The programme will not continue.
&WHAT_TO_DO&
You have four possible options.
- Full Mode - specific recipients - no WIND updates.
- Full Mode - all recipients - WIND updates can be performed.
- Delta Mode - specific recipients - no WIND updates.
- Delta Mode - all recipients - WIND updates can be performed.
&SYS_ADMIN&
The programme is designed to support selective updates for specific
recipients but in that situation the change pointers which are managed
in the WESD_WIND table should not be updated.
If you are happy to run the application for all recipients then the
WESD_WIND updates should normally be processed.
&CAUSE&
You entered values in one of the search fields specifically used for
credit card searching and also entered other card data in a separate
field. This combination is not allowed.
&SYSTEM_RESPONSE&
The search cannot be performed until you update or change your selection
criteria. Choose one way or the other when searching.
BACKGROUND
This programme is used to update the pricing details in the table
ZPOS_PRICELIST. This table should provide the current selling price for
all single items (or bundle items) for each store.
The data is created in several steps. The first step is in the WESOUT
process (see transaction code WESOUT). This takes data from several
input pricing conditions and produces a single output condition called
ZWSO which is that used as the standard basis for pricing transactions
in POS, S4 and Magento.
Once the ZWSO pricing condition is created it triggers the creation of a
change pointer in the WIND table which is then used by this programme.
In normal Delta Mode this programme looks for changes in the WIND table
(via the WESD_WIND) table and processes the updates.
At the same time it creates additional entries in table ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS
(Article / Price Status) which records the status for each new pricing
entry.
Finally, using those entries it is possible to generate an outbound IDoc
or perform further processing (label printing).
SELECTION SCREEN - MAIN OPTIONS
<AB>Full or Delta Update</>. These two options control whether the
programme will use the change pointers in the WIND tables as the basis
for adding data to the ZPOS_PRICELIST and ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS tables. The
normal default option would be to run the programme at least once per
day (usually much more often) to process changes.
The reason to run the programme in Full Update Mode could be that the
data in the ZPOS_PRICELIST table is out of sync with the current pricing
conditions, or simply to trigger a full update to one recipient (see
comments below about recipients).
<AB>Update WIND</>. This would normally be set as <AB>True</> by
default. In delta update mode the programme would read the list of
changes which need processing. It would process these and then mark the
records as processed by updating the entries in WESD_WIND table. You can
choose to update the WESD_WIND entries even if you are running a full
update. The logic in this case is that if you process all records then
you probably want to reset any change pointers (WIND entries) so that
you can process only new changes next time you run the delta update
mode.
<AB>Application</>. This option is only ever used in conjunction with
delta updates, as the parameter is needed when reading the WESD_WIND
table.
<AB>Data Recipient</>. This option is used when creating the records in
table ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS. There is one record created for the combination
of line from table ZPOS_PRICELIST and the matching records in
ZPOS_STORE_RCPT. So if one pricing record is to be sent to 4 recipients
then 4 records will be created in ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS.
Normally you should not put any entries in this table. The static
configuration table ZPOS_STORE_RCPT controls how many records need to be
created for each pricing records based on the store. You will be
prevented from using this option in conjunction with the option to
update the WIND entries. This is done because we do not wish to remove
WIND entries if they have not been processed for all recipient
applications.
An example of when you might want to use this is when you would
specifically like to do a full initial load for one recipient. You could
select Full Update, deactivate the Update WIND option and then choose
the specific recipient(s) from the list. This should then create the
necessary entries to process the outbound communication - see follow on
steps.
SELECTION SCREEN - ADDITIONAL OPTIONS
<AB>Date From / Date To</>. These options are only used in conjunction
with Full Updates. Using these options you can copy pricing data which
is valid between the two dates specified. The dates entered do NOT
represent a validity period in the normal sense - see example below.
Example: if you chose a range from 2021-01-01 until 2021-31-12 then
prices which have a start date less than 2021-31-12 (so any price which
comes into effect before the end of 2021). Those same prices need to
have an end date which is greater than 2021-01-01 (so no prices which
have already expired). So a typical selection criteria would be to set
the Date From to the current date, and the Date To should be sent until
the end of time (default options).
TABLE ZPOS_PRICELIST
This specific table contains a price for a given data range for each
store and barcode (aka GTIN / EAN). Each row in the table can be sent to
several recipients. The intention with this approach is to ensure that
ensure recipient receives exactly the same data.
The main pricing information contained within this table include the
"Normal" or "Standard" price, and the "Effective" or current selling
price.
This table does not include comparison pricing information or net prices
(prices without applicable taxes).
You can review the entries in transaction SE16 or SM30.
TABLE ZPOS_STORE_RCPT
As not all data is applicable for all recipients, this table controls
which data is sent to each recipient application. For example only
specific eCommerce stores are relevant for Magneto and this information
is mapping stores to recipient applications in configured in this table.
You can review the entries in transaction SE16 or SM30.
TABLE ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS
This is the main table used to control the overall processing status of
a record. As mentioned above there is one record created for the
combination of line from table ZPOS_PRICELIST and the matching records
in ZPOS_STORE_RCPT. So if one pricing record is to be sent to 4
recipients then 4 records will be created in ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS.
You can review the entries in transaction SE16 or SM30. There are some
simple utilities available to mass change the status of data in this
table, or delete historical entries.
FOLLOW-ON STEPS
Once the pricing data has been moved to the table ZPOS_PRICELIST and the
status records have been created in ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS then the data is
ready to be set out to recipients. This is controlled in another process
which will generate IDocs for each recipient and update the necessary
status records. See programme ZPOS_ARTICLE_OUTBOUND
BACKGROUND
This programme is used as a follow-on step to the programme
ZPOS_PERSIST_PRICELIST. This will take the article and pricing data
generated in the WESOUT process and create the outbound Article IDocs -
type ZPOS_ARTICLE.
The data is created in several steps. The first step is in the WESOUT
process (see transaction code WESOUT). This takes data from several
input pricing conditions and produces a single output condition called
ZWSO which is then used as the standard basis for pricing transactions
in POS, S4 and Magento.
At the same time article related attributes are stored in table
ZPOS_ARTICLE and ZPOS_ARTICLE_BOM. These tables contain data which is
not date specific - it is always the latest version of the information
and as such is an extraction of the Article Master tables.
The data stored in the pricing details in the table ZPOS_PRICELIST is
obviously date specific as is the status table ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS. This
pricing table should provide the current selling price for all single
items (or bundle items) for each store.
SELECTION SCREEN - OPTIONS
<AB>Sales Organization, Distribution Channel, Store</>. These selection
criteria are self-evident. They are optional. It will be common to leave
these selection options blank when processing all changes automatically
generated as a result of data changes.
<AB>Valid-On and Lead Time</>. These two values are used in combination
with each other. The valid-on parameter is used to decide which pricing
changes are selected. For a record to be considered as relevant it needs
to have a price starting on or before the specified date and ending on
or after that same date. The lead time parameter can be used to include
future price changes. A value of 2 days means today and tomorrow, so if
you only want prices valid today and to exclude anything which changes
tomorrow then you should set this value to 1
Normally the only choice you need to make as a user is whether you only
want prices valid today (then enter 1) or prices available today and
tomorrow (then set 2). If you want price changes one week in advance
then set the value to 7.
<AB>Data Recipient</>. Here you can choose which applications are in
scope for the generation of the IDocs. You must choose at least 1, but
can choose several, this would be the normal default mode. Each IDoc
which is generated will be specific to a Recipient and will only contain
data for 1 store.
<AB>Data Status</>. When data is generated and ready to be sent to
recipients it has status <AB>10 - Created</>. Normally you would not
change the value on the selection screen and simply process those
records which are available to be sent. Once the data has been sent the
status will change to <AB>20 - Sent</>, and in some cases it can have
status <AB>50 - Confirmed</>. The ability to change the status here is
only for rare situations where data should be resent. In those cases a
user could choose to select status 20 and then reprocess the data a
second time. A record will be kept in the status table of the date and
time the data is sent on each occasion.
<AB>Include Bill of Materials</>. Some applications (Magento) need
additional Article data to be sent in the IDoc. This option controls
whether or not those segments are generated in the IDoc where
applicable. This relates to bundles / sales sets. If a recipient does
not need to know this information you can exclude the data by
unselecting the option.
<AB>Records per IDoc</>. For optimal processing IDocs should not become
too big. This parameter gives the user the ability to control the size
of the IDoc. This is most applicable in large initial loads.
IDOC ZPOS_ARTICLE
A custom IDoc (ZPOS_ARTICLE) has been created for this process, it
consists of two segments. The main segment has a basic type of
ZPOS_ARTICLE_01. This contains 30-40 fields with Article and pricing
information. There is one instance of this segment for each article /
price combination. If the same article has two different prices on
different days then there will be 2 instances of this segment.
For each instance of the ZPOS_ARTICLE_01 segment it is possible to have
an unlimited number of child segments representing the contents of the
bundle / sales set. This segment is ZPOS_ARTICLE_BOM_01. This contains a
small number of fields describing the articles which form the bundle.
These child articles do not have their own pricing at this level, they
are priced based on the parent article.
Within the size constraint limits (Records per IDoc) each IDoc will
contain data for one Recipient Application and one Store.
PARTNER PROFILES
Create partner profiles for message type ZPOS_ARTICLE , IDoc type
ZPOS_ARTICLE_01, Message Function = Recipient Application eg. ES, MG,
VK.
Data is not sent to the Label Printing Application via IDocs.
BACKGROUND
This programme is remove entries from various table related to the
Article Price integration which may no longer be needed e.g. data older
than 30 days.
The programme deletes data from the following tables if the selection
criteria and applied logic are successful.
<AB> - ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS - Article Price Status Table</>
<AB> - ZPOS_PRICELIST - PriceList Table</>
<AB> - ZPOS_ARTICLE - Article Details Table</>
<AB>- ZPOS_ARTICLE_BOM - Article Bill of Materials Table</>
SELECTION SCREEN - OPTIONS
<AB>Sales Organization, Distribution Channel, Store</>. These selection
criteria are self-evident. They are optional. It will be common to leave
these selection options blank when removing data which is no longer
required.
<AB>Data Older Than ....</> This is probably the main selection criteria
and will select records which are older than the specified data. This
data must fulfill some other criteria before being deleted but this is
one key check.
<AB>Data Status</>. General Information. When data is generated ready to
send to recipients it has status 10 - Created, and then when it is
processed / sent it will have another status record with value 20.
<AB>Minimum Data status</>. This option allows the user to control which
statuses are included. By default the option is always set to 20. This
means that for each article / store / recipient / date the information
must have been sent. It is normal that the same record exists multiple
times with different statuses (or even the same status is possible). The
reason for this is that all statuses are stored based on their
timestamp. So in this case we remove all records belonging to the same
logical record and remove them as long as the most recent record has
reached the specified status. If however, the most recent record is a
lower status then none of the records belonging to this logical record
are removed. It is rare that a user would need to change this value.
<AB>Data Recipient</>. A user can choose to only delete data for
specific recipients. There are no obvious reasons for doing this but the
option is supported.
CONFIRMATION
Once the selection criteria have been entered there will be a final
confirmation to check that the user is certain they wish to continue. If
they agree then the data will be deleted instantly and cannot be
reversed.
If the programme is run in batch mode then there is no confirmation
checking, it is assumed that a user capable to creating batch jobs
understands the implications of the checks they are making.
BACKGROUND
This programme is used as a workaround for issues which may occur if the
store / recipient data was not maintained correctly at the time the
pricing data was generated.
If this happened then the necessary status records will be missing and
it would not be possible to send the IDoc to the surrounding systems.
In this case you have the possibility to generate the necessary status
records for a recipient application afterwards.
The programme will refer to the entries in table <AB>ZPOS_STORE_RECPT
</>(so this needs to be updated first). If the entry is found it will
then take the pricing data from (<AB>ZPOS_PRICELIST</>) and will then
create a status record with value <AB>10 - Created</> . is generated and
added to table <AB>ZPOS_ARTPRC_STS.</>
SELECTION SCREEN - OPTIONS
All fields must be populated!
<AB>Sales Organization, Distribution Channel, Store</>. These selection
criteria are self-evident.
<AB>Data Recipient</>. Select the value for the recipient application
for which the status records should be generated.
Next Steps
Once the data is generated it is possible to perform the subsequent
processing - such as sending data to external recipients.
